name: WebArchive
desc: A WebArchive object represents a webpage that can be archived—for example, archived on disk or on the pasteboard. A WebArchive object contains the main resource, as well as the subresources and subframes of the main resource. The main resource can be an entire webpage, a portion of a webpage, or some other kind of data such as an image. Use this class to archive webpages, or place a portion of a webpage on the pasteboard, or to represent rich web content in any application.

items.name: init!(mainResource: WebResource!, subresources: [Any]!, subframeArchives: [Any]!)
items.desc: Initializes the receiver with a resource and optional subresources and subframe archives..

items.name: init!(data: Data!)
items.desc: Initializes and returns the receiver, specifying the initial content data.

items.name: var subresources: [Any]!
items.desc: The receiver’s subresources, or nil if there are none.

items.name: var subframeArchives: [Any]!
items.desc: Archives representing the receiver’s subresources or nil if there are none.

items.name: var data: Data!
items.desc: The data representation of the receiver.
